alert.note: Alert for Buffalo (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 10:24AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity for the following rivers in Minnesota and Wisconsin... Mississippi River at La Crosse affecting Houston, La Crosse and Vernon Counties. Mississippi River at Wabasha affecting Buffalo and Wabasha Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Wabasha. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, The railroad goes out of operation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:15 AM CDT Wednesday was 15.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 16.4 feet early Tuesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.9 feet on 04/14/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water flow at these levels can be very dangerous. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon after 4 PM CDT.
